I'd like to think when CertainlyT decided to make a champion it came across like this, "Oh, let's make a completely insurd champion by giving him insane mobility, a defensive shield so people can't damage him at any time it's up, and a buggy windwall that blocks anything that comes at him from ANY ANGLE, or even things that were about to hit him but he threw it out of his ass anyway and it still blocked, double crit chance passive and, for the cherry on the cake, let's give him bonus armor pen on his ult that knocks you up while he screams HASAGI like a whopping cowboy. This one looks like a completely aggravating champion, doesn't he? Let's do it!" 

Yasuo is like Ekko- way to many things slapped onto his kit then they see him as their favorite playboy and leave him completely broken for months. 

No wonder so many people want him deleted. I know I do.

Its honestly sad. You can say the same thing about any champion and explain why they are overpowered or even overloaded with their kit. Honestly Yasuo's kit is designed for fighting. Like Zed, he is a high risk, high reward champion. When played correctly, he can be a pain in the ass yes. But if you play smart against him, then he wont be as much of a threat. He is supposed to capitalize off of mistakes. Lets talk about his Pros and Cons about all of his abilities shall we?

Passive: 
Pros: Double Crit chance, Shield based off level
Cons: Crit chance reduced to 90% (75% for Q), Capped Shield capacity, Takes about 20 seconds to get shield back up

Q: 
Pros: High damage, Low CD (scales off attack speed), Has knock up.
Cons: Very narrow, Need attack speed to lower CD, Tornado can be predicted easily 

W: 
Pros: Blocks projectiles of all sorts in front of him and roughly to the sides
Cons: Doesnt block turrets, can be walked through, lazers go through it, high CD, 3.75 seconds of wall

E: 
Pros: Very mobile, Stacking damage, Gap closer, used to dodge
Cons: Can only be used on one target every so often based off of E level, Can be interupted, lack of enemies means cant dodge well, AP scaling

R:
Pros: AOE damage, Armour Pen, Suspended for 1 second, Regains Flow bar
Cons: Commitment, can be QSS'd, Normally can be caught out and damaged during ult

As you can see, each of his abilities has cons to it that makes it more difficult to play him. Good yasuos though, can manage CDs to their advantage (can be said for every champion). He is very slippery but any form of hard CC will fuck him over in a team fight. If focused, he will die very quickly. Just like Riven, or any other carry top laners, if they are focused hard, they will be deleted from the fight. 

Early game: Wait for him to use his wind wall then go in for a trade. Bait out his wall and try to proc his shield. If you think he is going in for a trade, back off and keep distance from your minions. Sometimes staying near his minions is better. And if he is pushed up, ask for a gank. Ask for a jungler that has a point and click CC. Like Udyr, Mao, Voli, Malph, Jax, Hec, Irelia, etc. Also, if you are against a Yasuo, use Exhaust to slow, and reduced damage by 40%.

Mid Game: Keep an eye on him. If he is pushing too far, punish him for it. If he doesnt have minions he can only dash to camps or enemies. Never go in one by one against him. Always chain CC for maximum effectiveness. 4 man ganks will tilt them if they are cocky.

Late Game: He will enter the battle as the engager, or to clean up. So save your heavy CC to kill him. Or use it right off the back and wait for it to come back up. He is only useful when he gets a good knock-up or ult on many people. So try to spread out and make sure tanks
stay in the front to take a good amount of damage. Try your best to bait out his wall. His wall is a game changer if used properly in a late game teamfight. So try to apply a lot of poke on him to bait it out. Once it is used, engage on him with hard CC.

I am a yasuo main. I have been before the mastery system ever came out. Now one thing I have noticed over the years about yasuo is that he is building more tanky. But full AD yasuo is still a huge problem. His kit is DESIGNED to be a carry role. But like Fizz, Akali, Ekko, and someone like Zed, they can build tankier and still get good damage stats. 

If you want to complain about Yasuo, then do it to yourself. He, like many other fighters and somewhat assassins, can be dealt with easily with hard CC and being caught out. I have carried many games but lost because I was caught out. He may be a pain to deal with, but if you shut him down, and keep him down, there is no way that he can come back. He falls behind very very quickly. Keep these things in mind, and you should be able to fight him easier. Learn how to play Yasuo, so you know what counters him and what his weak points are. I have played him enough times, so i know most of his weak points. Though my mechanics with Yasuo are a bit higher than my rank, I dont have as much to worry about when I play him, because people dont know what it takes to play against him.

Many High Elo players love his design and his kit. Ask imaqtpie, voyboy and darshaan. See what they think about Yasuo. Ask any high elo player and they will say around the same things as I have. Also, play someone more mobile against Yasuo. If you can move around as much as he can, then it is harder for him to hit you. His kit is designed for fighting, so give him a break. Every champion has a kit that can be OP if played at a high level and if they can use their Pros to their advantage. 

I hope this help you realize that he isnt as OP as everyone claims he is. He is very fun to play as and gives you a challenge to try to master his kit. Overall, i believe that yes, because of his kit, he can have some majour outplays. But that is only if he is played at a high level. Please reconsider is OPness.
